site_title: 30 Units PHiZZ Ball by Thomas Hull

block_list.title: Video Tutorial
block_list.body: I saw this Kusudama and really wanted to make one. This is the 30 Units PHiZZ Ball designed by Thomas Hull. It's a modular origami model that looks like a combination of the Penultimate dodecahedron by Robert Neal and the 30 Unit Sonobe Icosahedron. Learn how to fold the module and assemble it in this video. Less than a minute origami. As usual, Enjoy!!! A side note for future reference. PHiZZ is an accronyme for Pentagon-Hexagon Zig-Zag. The unit is called the Pentagon-Hexagon Zig-Zag unit or PHiZZ Unit for short. Here at Heap Art, we are trying to help you practice origami on a regular bases. Every week I will select a minimum of 2 origami models and show you how to fold it. If you like origami and paper airplanes -- Please use the following link to subscribe to my channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/heapart?sub_confirmation=1 My Upload Schedule: Tuesday : A new Paper Airplane, part of my 100 Exotic Paper Airplane Challenge Friday : A new Origami Model never seen before on my channel
